title: HOT_HEAD
author: HOT_HEAD
content: I've tried joining a few pools for mining doge (back in the day when it came out) and a few more coins, and was thinking now to get back into all of that, but is it worth doing it without any crazy gear or miners?I'd be joining some pool, letting the miner run in the background at about 20-30% depending if I'm doing anything slightly demanding.

comments.author: HOT_HEAD
comments.body: Quote from: sxemini on July 21, 2022, 09:13:50 AMhttps://whattomine.com/I know about that website, but was looking for some first-hand experiences with pool mining alt-coins without a rig or a miner. Wouldn't be doing it as a job, jsut as a passive hobby and interest. Thanks tho.

Thanks tho.Anyone can do that as a hobby,hopefully you will have a core i5 CPU which is extremely common nowadays and you can try to mine Raptoreum,a CPU mineable coin which is really low in value and the difficulty of the network is also low,a 3rd gen Core i5 should make like 7-8 such coins per day.That is as a hobby,I do it in a much larger scale,I mine with 5 CPU-s and am mining near 40 coins per day because who knows if this is not the second Bitcoin or the second Monero and increases a lot in price,right now is 0.003 so extremely cheap and extremely easy to mine.
